<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> on the other side of the green baize door old jolyon sat at the long mahogany and leather board table his thick loose jointed tortoiseshell eye glasses perched on the bridge of his nose his gold pencil moving down the clauses of his will <\s>
<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>
<s> and so on in seven folios of brief and simple phraseology <\s>

<s> he had foreseen almost every contingency <\s>

<s> determining at once that her friend should not die she forgot in the institution of a campaign against death much of her own trouble <\s>

<s> here in contemplation of the venus de milo and the madeleine she shook off her depression and when towards the middle of october they returned to town her grandfather believed that he had effected a cure <\s>
<s> no sooner however had they established themselves in stanhope gate than he perceived to his dismay a return of her old absorbed and brooding manner <\s>
<s> she would sit staring in front of her her chin on her hand like a little norse spirit grim and intent while all around in the electric light then just installed shone the great drawing room brocaded up to the frieze full of furniture from baple and pullbred's <\s>
<s> and in the huge gilt mirror were reflected those dresden china groups of young men in tight knee breeches at the feet of full bosomed ladies nursing on their laps pet lambs which old jolyon had bought when he was a bachelor and thought so highly of in these days of degenerate taste <\s>
<s> he was a man of most open mind who more than any forsyte of them all had moved with the times but he could never forget that he had bought these groups at jobson's and given a lot of money for them <\s>

<s> they're not the gimcrack things you and your friends like but they cost me seventy pounds <\s>

<s> on the other side of the green baize door old jolyon sat at the long mahogany and leather board table his thick loose jointed tortoiseshell eye glasses perched on the bridge of his nose his gold pencil moving down the clauses of his will <\s>
<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> determining at once that her friend should not die she forgot in the institution of a campaign against death much of her own trouble <\s>

<s> he was a man of most open mind who more than any forsyte of them all had moved with the times but he could never forget that he had bought these groups at jobson's and given a lot of money for them <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> on the other side of the green baize door old jolyon sat at the long mahogany and leather board table his thick loose jointed tortoiseshell eye glasses perched on the bridge of his nose his gold pencil moving down the clauses of his will <\s>
<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> determining at once that her friend should not die she forgot in the institution of a campaign against death much of her own trouble <\s>

<s> he was a man of most open mind who more than any forsyte of them all had moved with the times but he could never forget that he had bought these groups at jobson's and given a lot of money for them <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>

<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>

<s> the memory of that change vivid and touching like the breaking open of a flower or the first sun after long winter the memory too of all that came after often intruded itself unaccountably inopportunely on lady baynes when her mind was set upon the most important things <\s>
<s> this was the very afternoon of the day that young jolyon witnessed the meeting in the botanical gardens and on this day too old jolyon paid a visit to his solicitors forsyte bustard and forsyte in the poultry <\s>
<s> soames was not in he had gone down to somerset house bustard was buried up to the hilt in papers and that inaccessible apartment where he was judiciously placed in order that he might do as much work as possible but james was in the front office biting a finger and lugubriously turning over the pleadings in forsyte v <\s>
<s> this sound lawyer had only a sort of luxurious dread of the nice point enough to set up a pleasurable feeling of fuss for his good practical sense told him that if he himself were on the bench he would not pay much attention to it <\s>
<s> but he was afraid that this bosinney would go bankrupt and soames would have to find the money after all and costs into the bargain <\s>
<s> and behind this tangible dread there was always that intangible trouble lurking in the background intricate dim scandalous like a bad dream and of which this action was but an outward and visible sign <\s>

<s> haven't seen you for an age <\s>
<s> you've been to switzerland they tell me <\s>
<s> this young bosinney he's got himself into a mess <\s>
<s> i knew how it would be <\s>
<s> he held out the papers regarding his elder brother with nervous gloom <\s>
<s> old jolyon read them in silence and while he read them james looked at the floor biting his fingers the while <\s>
<s> old jolyon pitched them down at last and they fell with a thump amongst a mass of affidavits in re buncombe deceased one of the many branches of that parent and profitable tree fryer v <\s>
<s> i don't know what soames is about he said to make a fuss over a few hundred pounds <\s>
<s> i thought he was a man of property <\s>
<s> james long upper lip twitched angrily he could not bear his son to be attacked in such a spot <\s>
<s> it's not the money he began but meeting his brother's glance direct shrewd judicial he stopped <\s>
<s> there was a silence <\s>
<s> i've come in for my will said old jolyon at last tugging at his moustache <\s>
<s> james curiosity was roused at once <\s>
<s> perhaps nothing in this life was more stimulating to him than a will it was the supreme deal with property the final inventory of a man's belongings the last word on what he was worth <\s>

<s> jolyon's will he said to an anxious dark haired clerk <\s>
<s> you going to make some alterations <\s>
<s> and through his mind there flashed the thought now am i worth as much as he <\s>

<s> james his fixed grey blue eye corkscrewing round some secret anxious image began again to bite his finger <\s>
<s> old jolyon took his will to the offices of the new colliery company and sat down in the empty board room to read it through <\s>
<s> he answered down by the starn hemmings so tartly when the latter seeing his chairman seated there entered with the new superintendent's first report that the secretary withdrew with regretful dignity and sending for the transfer clerk blew him up till the poor youth knew not where to look <\s>
<s> it was not by george as he down by the starn would have him know for a whippersnapper of a young fellow like him to come down to that office and think that he was god almighty <\s>
<s> he down by the starn had been head of that office for more years than a boy like him could count and if he thought that when he had finished all his work he could sit there doing nothing he did not know him hemmings down by the starn and so forth <\s>
<s> on the other side of the green baize door old jolyon sat at the long mahogany and leather board table his thick loose jointed tortoiseshell eye glasses perched on the bridge of his nose his gold pencil moving down the clauses of his will <\s>
<s> it was a simple affair for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities which fritter away a man's possessions and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds <\s>
<s> just a bequest to his son of twenty thousand and as to the residue of my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty or partaking of the nature of either upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to my said grand daughter june forsyte or her assigns during her life to be for her sole use and benefit and without etc ... <\s>
<s> and from and after her death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as the said june forsyte notwithstanding coverture shall by her last will and testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a will testament or testamentary disposition to be by her duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same and in default etc .... <\s>
<s> and so on in seven folios of brief and simple phraseology <\s>
<s> the will had been drawn by james in his palmy days <\s>
<s> he had foreseen almost every contingency <\s>
<s> old jolyon sat a long time reading this will at last he took half a sheet of paper from the rack and made a prolonged pencil note then buttoning up the will he caused a cab to be called and drove to the offices of paramor and herring in lincoln's inn fields <\s>
